#importing data
df = read.csv(file.choose(), header = TRUE)

#loading top 5 results
head(df)

#scatter plots
plot(df$誰..sepal_length, df$petal_length, pch = 15, xlab = "Iris Sepal Length", ylab = "Iris Petal Length", main = "Petal Length v. Sepal Length")

#add line to plot, height, color, line width
abline(h = 4, col = "red", lwd = 3)

#plot with only virginica
irisVir = df[df$species == "virginica",]

#actually plotting
plot(irisVir$誰..sepal_length, irisVir$petal_length, col = "Green", ylim = c(0,7), xlim = c(4,8))

#Only setosa species
irisVers = df[df$species == "versicolor",]

#points will not recreate plot, just adds new points to current plot
points(irisVers$誰..sepal_length, irisVers$petal_length, col = "Blue")

irisSet = df[df$species == "setosa",]
points(irisSet$誰..sepal_length, irisSet$petal_length, col = "Red")

#get rid of plot
dev.off()

#histograms
hist(df$petal_length, col = "Blue")

#get help on specific function => ?hist

#boxplot
boxplot(petal_length~species, data = df, main = "Petal Length v. Species")

#dividing plot space c(num rows, num columns)
par(mfrow = c(1,2))

hist(df$petal_length, col = "Blue")
boxplot(petal_length~species, data = df, main = "Petal Length v. Species")

#bar plots
age = c(22,21,24,24,26,18)
years_math_ed = c(4,5,2,3,5,2)
names = c("Scott", "Troy", "James", "Tamara", "Ben", "Kelly")
subject = c("Data Science", "Tech", "Engineering", "Healthcare", "Math", "Nursing")

df2 = data.frame(Age = age, Years = years_math_ed, Name = names, Subject = subject)

barplot(df2$Years, names.arg = df2$Name, ylab = "Math Years", col = "Blue", main = "Math Years")

#specific value counts
summary(df#species)

df$speciesFact = as.factor(df$species)
summary(df$speciesFact)

barplot(summary(df$speciesFact))
